intro: Cupania riopalenquensis, commonly known as the Rio Palenquensis Cupania, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves that are often elliptical in shape. The plant produces small, clustered greenish-yellow flowers, which are typically inconspicuous and not showy. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in humid lowland forests. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
